biolockj.module

Interface BioModule

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ClassifierModule, JavaModule, ParserModule, ScriptModule
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AddMetaToTaxonomyTables, AwkFastaConverter, BioModuleImpl, BuildFoldChangePlots, BuildMdsPlots, BuildOtuPlots, BuildPvalHistograms, BuildQiimeMapping, BuildTaxonomyTables, CalculateStats, ClassifierModuleImpl, CompileOtuCounts, Demultiplexer, Email, Gunzipper, ImportMetadata, JavaModuleImpl, JsonReport, Kraken2Classifier, Kraken2Parser, KrakenClassifier, KrakenParser, LogTransformer, MergeOtuTables, MetaphlanClassifier, MetaphlanParser, Multiplexer, Normalizer, ParserModuleImpl, PearMergeReads, PostRarefier, PreRarefier, QiimeClassifier, QiimeClosedRefClassifier, QiimeDeNovoClassifier, QiimeOpenRefClassifier, QiimeParser, R_Module, RdpClassifier, RdpParser, RegisterNumReads, RemoveLowCountOtus, RemoveScarceOtus, ScriptModuleImpl, SeqFileValidator, SlimmClassifier, SlimmParser, TrimPrimers

    public interface BioModule
    Classes that implement this interface are eligible to be included in a BioLockJ pipeline.
    Use the #BioModule tag with the class name in the Config file to include a module.
    The Pipeline class executes BioModules in the order provided in the Config file.

    BioModule Directory Structure

    Directory Description
    output Contains all module output files
    temp Holds intermediate files generated by the module, but are not to be passed on to the next module. This directory will deleted after pipeline execution if "project.deleteTempFiles" = "Y"

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String MAIN_SCRIPT_PREFIX
      Script prefix appended to start of file name to indicate the main script in the script directory.
      static String OUTPUT_DIR
      Name of the output sub-directory
      static String TEMP_DIR
      Name of the temporary sub-directory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkDependencies()
      During pipeline initialization, all configured BioModules will run this method to validate dependencies.
      void cleanUp()
      This method executes after execution to update Config modified by the module or other cleanup operations.
      void executeTask()
      This is the main method called when it is time for the BioModule to complete its task.
      List<File> getInputFiles()
      Each BioModule takes the previous BioModule output as input:
      BioModule[ n ].getInputFiles() = BioModule[ n - 1 ].getOutputDir().listFiles()
      Special cases:
      The 1st BioModule return all files in "input.dirPaths"
      If previous BioModule BioModule[ n - 1 ] is a MetadataModule, forward it's input + output file: BioModule[ n ].getInputFiles() = BioModule[ n -1 ].getInputFiles() + BioModule[ n -1 ].getOutputFiles()
      File getModuleDir()
      Each BioModule generates sub-directory under $DOCKER_PROJ
      File getOutputDir()
      Output files destined as input for the next BioModule is created in this directory.
      List<Class<?>> getPostRequisiteModules()
      Pipeline calls this method when building the list of pipeline BioModules to execute.
      List<Class<?>> getPreRequisiteModules()
      Pipeline calls this method when building the list of pipeline BioModules to execute.
      String getSummary()
      Gets the BioModule execution summary, this is sent as part of the notification email, if configured.
      Summary should not include data content, to avoid unintentional publication of confidential information.
      However, meta-data such as number/size of files can be helpful during debug.
      File getTempDir()
      Contains intermediate files generated by the module but not used by the next BioModule.
      The files may contain supplementary information or data that may be helpful during debug or recovery.
      If "project.deleteTempFiles" = "Y", successful pipelines delete this directory.
      boolean isValidInputModule(BioModule previousModule)
      BioModules getInputFiles() method typically, but not always, return the previousModule output files.
      void setModuleDir(String filePath)
      Pipeline calls this method to set the name of each BioModule root directory.
      Module root directories are created directly under the "internal.pipelineDir" pipeline root directory.
      Modules are numbered in order included in the Config and named after the Java class name.

    • Field Detail

      • MAIN_SCRIPT_PREFIX

        static final String MAIN_SCRIPT_PREFIX
        Script prefix appended to start of file name to indicate the main script in the script directory. BioModules that generate scripts must create exactly one main script.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        static final String OUTPUT_DIR
        Name of the output sub-directory
        See Also:

      • TEMP_DIR

        static final String TEMP_DIR
        Name of the temporary sub-directory
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • checkDependencies

        void checkDependencies()
                throws Exception
        During pipeline initialization, all configured BioModules will run this method to validate dependencies.
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if missing or invalid dependencies are found

      • cleanUp

        void cleanUp()
      throws Exception
        This method executes after execution to update Config modified by the module or other cleanup operations.
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if any runtime error occurs

      • executeTask

        void executeTask()
          throws Exception
        This is the main method called when it is time for the BioModule to complete its task.
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if the module is unable to complete is task

      • getInputFiles

        List<File> getInputFiles()
                  throws Exception
        Each BioModule takes the previous BioModule output as input:
        BioModule[ n ].getInputFiles() = BioModule[ n - 1 ].getOutputDir().listFiles()
        Special cases:
        • The 1st BioModule return all files in "input.dirPaths"
        • If previous BioModule BioModule[ n - 1 ] is a MetadataModule, forward it's input + output file: BioModule[ n ].getInputFiles() = BioModule[ n -1 ].getInputFiles() + BioModule[ n -1 ].getOutputFiles()
        Returns:
        Input files
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to obtain input files

      • getModuleDir

        File getModuleDir()
        Each BioModule generates sub-directory under $DOCKER_PROJ
        Returns:
        BioModule root directory

      • getOutputDir

        File getOutputDir()
        Output files destined as input for the next BioModule is created in this directory.
        Returns:
        File directory containing the primary BioModule output

      • getPostRequisiteModules

        List<Class<?>> getPostRequisiteModules()
                                throws Exception
        Pipeline calls this method when building the list of pipeline BioModules to execute. Any BioModules returned by this method will be added to the pipeline after the current BioModule. If multiple post-requisites are found, the modules will be added in the order listed.
        Returns:
        List of BioModules
        Throws:
        Exception - if invalid Class names are returned as post-requisites

      • getPreRequisiteModules

        List<Class<?>> getPreRequisiteModules()
                               throws Exception
        Pipeline calls this method when building the list of pipeline BioModules to execute. Any BioModules returned by this method will be added to the pipeline before the current BioModule. If multiple prerequisites are returned, the modules will be added in the order listed.
        Returns:
        List of BioModules
        Throws:
        Exception - if invalid Class names are returned as prerequisites

      • getSummary

        String getSummary()
           throws Exception
        Gets the BioModule execution summary, this is sent as part of the notification email, if configured.
        Summary should not include data content, to avoid unintentional publication of confidential information.
        However, meta-data such as number/size of files can be helpful during debug.
        Returns:
        Summary of BioModule execution
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs

      • getTempDir

        File getTempDir()
        Contains intermediate files generated by the module but not used by the next BioModule.
        The files may contain supplementary information or data that may be helpful during debug or recovery.
        If "project.deleteTempFiles" = "Y", successful pipelines delete this directory.
        Returns:
        File directory of files typically not useful long term

      • isValidInputModule

        boolean isValidInputModule(BioModule previousModule)
                    throws Exception
        BioModules getInputFiles() method typically, but not always, return the previousModule output files. This method checks the output directory from the previous module to check for input deemed acceptable by the current module. The conditions coded in this method will be checked on each previous module in the pipeline until acceptable input is found. If no previous module produced acceptable input, the files under Config."input.dirPaths" are returned.

        This method can be overridden by modules that need input files generated prior to the previous module.
        Parameters:
        previousModule - BioModule that ran before the current BioModule
        Returns:
        boolean TRUE if the previousModule output is acceptable input for the current BioModule
        Throws:
        Exception - if unexpected errors occur

      • setModuleDir

        void setModuleDir(String filePath)
        Pipeline calls this method to set the name of each BioModule root directory.
        Module root directories are created directly under the "internal.pipelineDir" pipeline root directory.
        Modules are numbered in order included in the Config and named after the Java class name.
        Parameters:
        filePath - String filePath of the module directory
